description: The U.S. open saw some major upsets over the holiday weekend. Emma Navarro beat fan-favorite and fellow American Coco Gauff to advance to the quarter-finals. On the men's side, three Americans are among the final 16. Charles Eccleshare, tennis writer for the Athletic, joins to discuss.
title: U.S. Open sees major tennis upsets

description: Houston says it has collected 250 tons of plastic since the end of 2022, but almost none of it has been recycled yet.
title: Houston's plastic waste piles up, waiting on "advanced recycling"

description: David Frangioni is the publisher of Modern Drummer and has also amassed a collection of some of the most famous drum kits in rock and roll history. After years of collecting, he decided to open the Frangioni Foundation to help inspire a new generation of drummers.
title: Drummer and collector opens school to inspire young musicians

description: Parts of Texas are expected to deal with heavy rain and flooding while temperatures could swing wildly on the coasts. CBS Miami meteorologist Ivan Cabrera has the forecast.
title: Texas braces for heavy rain, flooding

description: Four people were killed in what police are calling a random shooting on Chicago's blue line train as it was pulling into its last stop in Forest Park. A suspect is in custody. CBS Chicago's Tara Molina reports.
title: 4 killed in Chicago-area "L" train shooting

description: President Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris on Monday met with their hostage negotiating team to try to come up with a new way forward to secure a cease-fire between Israel and Hamas and free those still being held in Gaza. Scott MacFarlane has the latest.
title: Biden, Harris meet with team to discuss cease-fire deal and hostage release

description: Vice President Kamala Harris and President Biden appeared together at a campaign event Monday in Pennsylvania, their first joint campaign event since Mr. Biden dropped out of the race. Harris also campaigned in Detroit, where she was joined by union leaders as she looked up to shore up support among a crucial voting block on Labor Day. Ed O'Keefe reports.
title: Harris, Biden campaign together for first time since president dropped out

description: So-called advanced recycling has been touted as a way to recycle every type of plastic, which would help cut down on the problem of plastic waste. But a program is Houston is lagging behind, as the waste piles up in a warehouse. Ben Tracy has the story.
title: Plastic waste piles up in Houston, waiting on "advanced recycling"

description: As millions headed home Monday at the end of Labor Day weekend, rough weather and technical problems caused flight delays nationwide. Striking hotel workers in major cities also made things tricky for some travelers. Errol Barnett has more.
title: Weather, technical issues cause Labor Day travel problems

description: A funeral was held for Hersh Goldberg-Polin, an Israeli-American who was found dead in Gaza after being taken hostage by Hamas on Oct. 7. His and five other hostages' deaths have sparked a series of protests in Israel, with demonstrators demanding Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu agree to a cease-fire deal to free the remaining hostages. Imtiaz Tyab reports.
title: Israeli-American hostage killed in Gaza laid to rest

description: Brazil's supreme court has upheld a ban on the social media platform X, formerly known as Twitter. The vote backs a decision by one of the judge's made on Friday. The ban went into effect on Saturday and will stay in place until the company agrees to an order requiring X to name a legal representative in Brazil.
title: Brazil's supreme court upholds ban on social media platform X

description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Evening News" with Nancy Cordes.
title: "CBS Evening News" headlines for Monday, Sept. 2, 2024

description: Joey Chestnut ate a world record 83 hot dogs in 10 minutes on Monday, relishing another victory against rival Takeru Kobayashi.
title: Joey Chestnut sets new world record in Netflix hot dog eating competition

description: Pope Francis is headed to Asia for what is one of the longest foreign trips any head of the Catholic Church has ever embarked on. The pontiff will engage in interfaith dialogues with other religious leaders as Catholicism's popularity rises on the continent. CBS News producer Anna Matranga has more from Rome.
title: Pope Francis embarks on 12-day trip to Asia

description: President Biden told reporters Monday he did not think Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was doing enough to reach a final deal to release hostages in exchange for a cease-fire in Gaza. But he placed the blame of the death of six hostages squarely on Hamas, saying their "leaders will pay for these crimes." Mark Cancian, senior adviser for the International Security Program at the Center for Strategic and International Studies, joins to discuss.
title: Biden rebukes Hamas for hostage deaths, calls on Netanyahu to do more

description: The U.S. has seized a plane belonging to Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro over alleged sanctions violations. The jet in question has been transported from the Dominican Republic to Florida. CBS News correspondent Cristian Benavides has more from Fort Lauderdale.
title: What's behind the U.S. seizure of Nicolás Maduro's plane

description: As the Labor Day holiday weekend wraps up, millions of Americans will be traveling across the country to make it back home. The TSA expects to screen over 17 million travelers from Aug. 29 through Sept. 4 -- nearly nine percent more than last year. The busy weekend caps off a record-breaking summer for the travel industry. CBS News national correspondent Errol Barnett has the latest from New York's LaGuardia Airport.
title: Labor Day caps record-breaking summer travel season

description: On this Labor Day, Democrats have been on the campaign trail working to secure the vote of union workers in battleground states. After starting the day with a rally in Detroit, Vice President Kamala Harris joined President Biden in Pittsburgh to speak to U.S. steelworkers. CBS News campaign reporter Aaron Navarro has more.
title: President Biden joins VP Harris for Labor Day campaign blitz

description: Gunfire rang out in two major U.S. cities on Monday. In a Chicago suburb, four people were killed on a train. Police say the shooter did not appear to know the victims and the attack was random. New York City police say at least five were wounded at a shooting along the the West Indian American Day parade route.
title: Gun violence plagues Labor Day in Chicago and NYC

description: The deaths of six Hamas-held hostages have sparked protests across Israel, with people demanding a cease-fire deal. Much of the anger among protesters is being directed at Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu for failing to commit to a deal to secure the release of hostages. CBS News contributor Robert Berger explains.
title: Why Netanyahu is under fire in Israel after deaths of hostages

description: The Marines were taken to a local hospital for evaluation as a precaution and have returned to the ship, the Navy says.
title: 2 U.S. Marines attacked in Turkey, Navy says

description: Clean your clothing faster and more efficiently with a new on-sale washer and dryer this Labor Day.
title: The best washer and dryer deals for Labor Day 2024

description: Save up to 50% this Labor Day at Amazon, Walmart, Target, Home Depot and more top retailers.
title: Best Labor Day deals you can shop now at all retailers

description: Scrambling to cut costs, Germany's Volkswagen warns it could shutter factories in the automaker's home country amid rising competition.
title: Volkswagen could close plant in Germany for the first time ever

description: Save up to 70% off on furniture from some of our favorite home retailers, including West Elm, Wayfair and more.
title: Best Labor Day furniture sales to shop today

description: Save up to 70% off on furniture from some of our favorite home retailers, including West Elm, Wayfair and more.
title: Best Labor Day furniture sales to shop today

description: Don't miss this Labor Day deal on the 4.6-star-rated Waterpik Aquarius water flosser.
title: This water flosser is more life changing than you think. And it's 41% off at Amazon

description: At least five people were shot at New York City's West Indian American Day Parade on Monday, according to the NYPD. There is no active shooter and the shooting appeared to be an "intentional act," NYPD Chief of Patrol John Chell said at a press conference. Police are looking for a suspect.
title: At least 5 shot at NYC's West Indian Day parade in "intentional act," police say

description: In New Jersey, Americans are racing on the beach in Ocean City to celebrate Labor Day as the 2024 summer approaches its end. CBS News Philadelphia's Kim Hudson reports.
title: How Americans are celebrating Labor Day

description: The Federal Reserve is expected to cut interest rates in September as inflation appears to cool. CBS News contributor Javier E. David has more on what to expect.
title: Here's what the Federal Reserve may do to interest rates in September

description: President Biden said Monday that he does not believe Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is doing enough to reach a cease-fire and hostage release deal between Israel and Hamas. CBS News contributor Robert Berger has more.
title: Biden says Benjamin Netanyahu isn't doing enough on cease-fire, hostage deal

description: A boy who broke a 3,500-year-old ancient artifact that was being displayed at the Hecht Museum at the University of Haifa in Israel was invited back in an act of forgiveness by the staff. CBS News' Tina Kraus has the story.
title: Boy who broke 3,500-year-old jar invited back to museum

description: More than a million New Yorkers are expected to celebrate the West Indian American Day Carnival and Parade over Labor Day. CBS News New York's Hannah Kliger has more.
title: New York celebrates West Indian Day Parade on Labor Day

description: Former President Donald Trump criticized the publicity over his campaign's involvement in an incident at Arlington National Cemetery's Section 60. CBS News politics reporter Zak Hudak reports.
title: Donald Trump says he doesn't need Arlington National Cemetery publicity

description: Vice President Kamala Harris courted voters in Detroit at a rally where she addressed union members during Labor Day. Harris is headed to a campaign event next in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, with President Biden. CBS News campaign reporter Nidia Cavazos has more.
title: Kamala Harris rallies Michigan voters, heads to Pennsylvania for event with Biden

description: Hewlett Packard declines to drop U.K. claim for damages against the estate of British tech mogul Mike Lynch.
title: HP pursues suit against tech mogul who died when his yacht sank

description: The Justice Department says the U.S. seized a plane purchased through shell companies that has been in use by Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro. CBS News' Shanelle Kaul has more.
title: U.S. seizes Nicolás Maduro's plane

description: Americans traveling for the Labor Day weekend are returning home after benefitting from this summer's lower gas prices and domestic travel deals. CBS News' Errol Barnett updates the weather and travel conditions.
title: Labor Day weekend travel. What to expect.

description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz's vehicle was not involved in the crash, according to the campaign.
title: Motorcade accompanying VP nominee Tim Walz involved in crash

description: President Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris met with the U.S. hostage deal negotiation team in the White House Situation Room Monday as protests are erupting in Israel over Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's handling of the cease-fire with Hamas. CBS News' Skyler Henry reports.
title: Biden, Harris met in Situation Room on Israel-Hamas cease-fire deal

description: Clerance George was charged with murder and aggravated assault in the June 2000 death of Julie Ann McDonald.
title: 24 years after woman murdered in Georgia, suspect arrested in Alabama

description: Funeral for American-Israeli killed by Hamas held in Jerusalem; U.S. Department of Justice seizes Venezuelan president's plane
title: 9/2: CBS News 24/7 Episode 2

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he asked for forgiveness from families of Oct. 7, 2023, hostages held in Hamas after they were killed in captivity. This comes as Israeli-American Hersh Goldberg-Polin's funeral occurred in Jerusalem. CBS News contributor Robert Berger has more.
title: Benjamin Netanyahu asks for forgiveness as Israel protests, families mourn killed hostages

description: The U.S. seized Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro's plane in the Dominican Republic and brought it to the U.S. on Monday, the Justice Department said.
title: U.S. seizes Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro's plane

description: Roderick Townsend, who has an upper right shoulder impairment after sustaining nerve damage at birth, considers himself the "bad guy."
title: USA's Townsend wins 3rd high jump gold at Paralympics

description: There are several anticipated films coming out this fall, including "Beetlejuice Beetlejuice,​" "Joker: Folie à Deux," "Transformers One" and "Wicked." Fandango's managing editor, Erik Davis, joins "CBS Mornings" with his must-see movie picks.
title: Fall movie preview: "Beetlejuice Beetlejuice,​" "Wicked," more

description: Vice President Kamala Harris plans to make the announcement in Pittsburgh alongside President Biden.
title: Harris to oppose sale of U.S. Steel to a Japanese firm during Pittsburgh event

description: Thousands of hotel employees are on strike and the walk-out is expected to last at least another day. Hilton, Hyatt, Fairmont and Marriott properties are being affected. Lauren Kaori Gurley, a labor reporter for The Washington Post, joins CBS News with more on where the hotels are located and what workers demand.
title: Why hotel workers are on strike across the U.S.

description: The man was finally arrested after he brought the victim to a hospital for treatment of a dislocated shoulder.
title: Man accused of holding woman captive, abusing her for 5 years

description: Russia launched a drone attack targeting Ukraine's Kyiv and the foreign minister there said some of the missiles fired were supplied by North Korea. CBS News senior foreign correspondent Holly Williams reports.
title: Ukraine's Kyiv rocked by Russian drone, missile strikes

description: Hotel workers have been locked in contract negotiations with chains including Hilton, Hyatt and Marriott.
title: Here are the hotels across the U.S. impacted by a worker strike

description: Protests erupt in Israel after deaths of six hostages in Gaza; CDC steps in with plan to boost child vaccination rates.
title: 9/2: CBS News 24/7 Episode 1

description: Adi Alexander, whose son Edan is still believed to be in Hamas captivity, calls on Israel to reach a cease-fire and hostage release deal.
title: Father of captive says deaths of 6 Israeli hostages "never had to happen"

description: Millions of Americans are returning home from their Labor Day holiday weekend travels after a summer of lower airfares and cheaper gas prices compared to recent years. CBS News' Errol Barnett has more.
title: How to make Labor Day travel easier

description: Former President Donald Trump and running mate Ohio Sen. JD Vance are off the campaign trail for Labor Day before campaign events this week in Pennsylvania, North Carolina and Wisconsin, key battleground states in the 2024 election. CBS News campaign reporter Libby Cathey has more.
title: Donald Trump hitting battleground states after Labor Day

description: RMS Titanic Inc., which holds the legal rights to the 112-year-old wreck, completed its first trip since 2010 and released images from the expedition.
title: New images of Titanic reveal part of iconic bow's railing collapsed

description: Democrats are holding events in the key battleground states of Pennsylvania and Wisconsin as the Labor Day holiday weekend marks the final phase of the 2024 election. CBS News campaign reporter Aaron Navarro has more of Vice President Kamala Harris' event with President Biden, and what Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz is up to in the Midwest.
title: Harris, Walz busy Labor Day in Pennsylvania, Wisconsin

description: There are major disruptions in Israel over Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's approach to the Israel-Hamas war and the stalled cease-fire talks. Histadrut union, the country's largest labor union, went on strike to call for a cease-fire deal. CBS News' Imtiaz Tyab reports.
title: Major protests in Israel against Benjamin Netanyahu after hostages killed

description: In her new memoir, "Lovely One," Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson writes about her journey to the U.S. Supreme Court, becoming the first Black female justice. In this web exclusive, she talks with "CBS Evening News" anchor and managing editor Norah O'Donnell about what having a Black woman as president would mean to her.
title: Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson on electing a Black woman as president

description: A suspect was located on a CTA Pink Line train and was taken into custody. A weapon was recovered.
title: 4 people shot and killed on Chicago-area Blue Line train

description: Protesters in Israel say Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has stalled a Gaza cease-fire and hostage deal while more than 100 people are still believed to be held by Hamas. The hostages include 20-year-old Edan Alexander, a New Jersey native who volunteered to serve in the IDF after high school. His parents, Adi and Yael Alexander, join "CBS Mornings."
title: Gaza cease-fire, hostage return proposal is "now or never," father of Israeli captive says

description: Thousands in Israel have taken to the streets to protest their own government after six more hostages were found dead in Gaza. Also, San Francisco 49ers wide receiver Ricky Pearsall is out of the hospital and recovering after being shot in an alleged armed robbery attempt. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: Massive protests break out in Israel

description: Meghan Joyce is the founder and CEO of Duckbill, a virtual assistant service for busy adults. The company says it uses artificial intelligence along with human "co-pilots" to "check off your to-dos until they're done, exactly the way you would." Joyce joins "CBS Mornings" as part of the series, "Changing the Game."
title: Duckbill CEO explains how app can be a "personal assistant in your pocket" | Changing the Game

description: Cal Fire investigators believe that the fire was "human caused."
title: Multiple firefighters injured as huge "human caused" brush fire burns in Riverside County

description: Walt Disney Co. pulled ESPN, its Disney network and ABC stations from DirecTV's service, a move that came on a busy sports night.
title: DirecTV customers suddenly can't get ESPN and Disney shows. Here's why.

description: USC's upset win over LSU topped off an eventful weekend of college football especially for the expanded Big Ten Conference, where every team won except for Minnesota. "CBS Saturday Morning" co-host Dana Jacobson has a look at some of the weekend's biggest matchups.
title: Recapping the week's biggest college football matchups

description: Vice President Kamala Harris and President Biden are in Pittsburgh Monday for their first joint campaign event since Harris became the Democratic presidential nominee. They aim to court union voters in the battleground state. Former President Donald Trump returns to Pennsylvania on Wednesday. CBS News contributor Joel Payne, the chief communications officer for the progressive group MoveOn, joins "CBS Mornings" to discuss the campaigns.
title: How Biden can help Harris, importance of Harris-Trump debate, more on 2024 campaign

description: San Francisco 49ers rookie wide receiver Ricky Pearsall is out of the hospital and recovering less than 48 hours after he was shot during an attempted robbery, police say. A 17-year-old suspect was arrested. CBS News' Elise Preston has the latest on the investigation.
title: San Francisco 49ers' Ricky Pearsall recovering after shooting

description: Outrage is boiling over in Israel against the Netanyahu government after six hostages were killed in Gaza. The country now faces a nationwide strike following mass demonstrations over the weekend, demanding the prime minister step down. CBS News foreign correspondent Imtiaz Tyab has the latest.
title: Outrage in Israel over killings of 6 hostages

description: U.S. energy infrastructure has proven to be problematic as-is, and threats to its reliability are growing. Experts say there's a solution.
title: Electricity prices are on the rise. Is it inflation or an underlying issue?

description: More Americans are having to choose between food and energy bills as the price of electricity rises. The cost is based on many factors, but one stands out from the rest — and is likely only going to make matters more complicated and expensive.
title: The Climate Election: Your rising energy bills explained

description: Israel's biggest union goes on strike as Benjamin Netanyahu faces a surge of anger and demands to nail down a cease-fire with Hamas.
title: Israeli labor strike piles pressure on Netanyahu after hostages killed

description: "I know what this can all lead to," a German WWII survivor warns after the far-right AfD party's first state election win.
title: Far-right's German state election win fuels fear of past, and for future

description: As students return to the classroom, more schools are banning phones or otherwise restricting their use.
title: Schools across U.S. restrict cellphones as students return to the classroom

description: "The patient obviously had received some serious lacerations and puncture wounds from the animal. She was quite pale," an official added.
title: Tiger attacks and injures handler at Australia theme park

description: The land seizure is considered the biggest in recent history, with officials estimating the drugs are worth at least $200 million.
title: Huge stash of cocaine seized in jungle after "narco sub" found

description: Witnesses reported that a man used a front-end loader to ram cars, then fatally shot three women, before he was killed by a resident, police said.
title: 3 women killed, gunman dead after neighbors' dispute in Hawaii

description: Former Gulf Cartel leader Osiel Cardenas Guillen once led Los Zetas, one of the country's most bloodthirsty gangs until its collapse.
title: Ex-cartel leader dubbed "Friend Killer" released from U.S. prison

description: Ukraine says Russia launched dozens of missiles and drones at Kyiv, wounding three people and damaging kindergartens ahead of the return to school.
title: Ukraine says 3 hurt as dozens of Russian missiles, drones target Kyiv

description: Here's what is open and closed on Labor Day 2024, from retailers such as Costco to pharmacies including CVS and Walgreens.
title: Here's what is open and closed on Labor Day 2024

description: Protests erupt in Israel after 6 hostages found dead; Swimmer who lost leg in shark attack competes at Paralympics
title: 9/1: CBS Weekend News

description: First, Gina Raimondo: The 60 Minutes Interview. Then, a report on the forgotten Nazi camp built on British soil. And, a look at teens’ innovative Pythagorean Theorem work.
title: 9/1/2024: Secretary of Commerce; On British Soil; St. Mary's

description: For this edition of "The Takeout," Major Garrett sits down with filmmaker Ibrahim Nash'at. While working on his new documentary "Hollywoodgate," Nash'at spent months chronicling a Taliban commander's swift seizure of Afghanistan. However, as he tells Garrett, he was often at great personal risk while making the documentary.
title: 9/1: The Takeout: Filmmaker Ibrahim Nash'at

description: As a new school year is set to begin, some areas are seeing lower levels of vaccinations, which could make kids more susceptible to diseases like measles and whooping cough. Thd CDC is stepping up efforts to help get kids vaccinated, including those from lower income family who may struggle to afford health care. Celine Gounder reports.
title: CDC stepping up efforts to get kids vaccinated ahead of school year
